Sentencas: The CeO2-based electrolytes of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) with high ionic conductivity have attracted considerable attention.
Titulo: Performance optimization of Ca and Y co-doped CeO2-based electrolyte for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this study, Ca and Y co-doped Ce0.8Y0.2-xCaxO2-delta (x = 0, 0.05, 0.1, and 0.15, abbreviated as YDC, YCDC05, YCDC10, and YCDC15) electrolytes were prepared, and their properties were investigated for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (IT-SOFCs).
Titulo: Performance optimization of Ca and Y co-doped CeO2-based electrolyte for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: All samples formed a cubic fluorite structure at a low sintering temperature (600 degrees C).
Titulo: Performance optimization of Ca and Y co-doped CeO2-based electrolyte for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: At 800 degrees C, the YCDC05 electrolyte exhibited the highest conductivity (0.10 S cm(-1)), which was approximately 54% higher than that of the YDC electrolyte.
Titulo: Performance optimization of Ca and Y co-doped CeO2-based electrolyte for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The YCDC05 had the highest grain boundary scavenging factor and the smallest blocking factor.
Titulo: Performance optimization of Ca and Y co-doped CeO2-based electrolyte for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The blocking factor of YCDC05 was reduced by 49%, compared with that of YDC at 400 degrees C.
Titulo: Performance optimization of Ca and Y co-doped CeO2-based electrolyte for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The density functional theory calculation results showed that the oxygen vacancy formation energy of the Y and Ca co-doped (YCDC) electrolyte was lower than that of YDC.
Titulo: Performance optimization of Ca and Y co-doped CeO2-based electrolyte for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Therefore, Ce0.8Y0.15Ca0.05O2-delta may be a potential electrolyte material for IT-SOFCs.
Titulo: Performance optimization of Ca and Y co-doped CeO2-based electrolyte for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells
